Class ComplexImage

Kernel ANSI C ComplexImage routines, last updated 7/15/2002. More...


Modules

ComplexImage C only
 Kernel ANSI C only routines, last updated 11/24/1999.


Data Structures

struct  TComplexImage
 An image containing real and imaginary pixels of type FLOAT32. More...


Functions

void kC_EmptyImage (TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Deletes all allocated memory for image, origo to (0,0), sets colors in pInfo to zero and all pointers to NULL.

void kC_InitImage (TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Sets all the pointers in pInfo to NULL, Origin to EMPTY and origo to (0,0), allways call this function when creating a new TComplexImage variable.

bool kC_AllocImage (UINT32 Width, UINT32 Height, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Initialises a new image with given dimensions.

bool kC_AllocImageFast (UINT32 Width, UINT32 Height, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Initialises a new image with given dimensions.

bool kC_FlushImage (FLOAT32 Re, FLOAT32 Im, TComplexImage *pDest)
 Sets all pixels in the image to given color.

bool kC_Load (const char *FileName, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Load given file into "pInfo".

bool kC_Save (const char *FileName, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Save given file to disc, the file name must comply with the same rules as in kC_Load.

bool kC_SetBorder (UINT16 Size, FLOAT32 Re, FLOAT32 Im, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Sets a border around image of size "Size", initialised to "Color".

bool kC_SetBorderSize (UINT16 Size, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Sets a border around image of size "Size", not initialised.

bool kC_SetBorderColor (FLOAT32 Re, FLOAT32 Im, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Sets the color of the border.

bool kC_SetPeriodicBorder (unsigned short BorderSize, TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Expands the image periodically in the border of size BorderSize.

bool kC_CopyImage (TComplexImage *pDest, const TComplexImage *pSource)
 Copies whole image from "pSource" to "pDest".

bool kC_CopySubImage (int xmin, int ymin, int xmax, int ymax, TComplexImage *pDest, const TComplexImage *pSource)
 Copy rectangel from "pSource" to "pDest".

void kC_Rotate90 (int Steps, TComplexImage *pSource)
 Rotate image clockwise in step of 90 degrees.

void kC_FlipHorisontal (TComplexImage *pSource)
 Flip image around a centered horisontal line.

void kC_FlipVertical (TComplexImage *pSource)
 Flip image around a centered vertical line.

int kC_GetMinX (const TComplexImage *Img)
 Iterate from this value.

int kC_GetMinY (const TComplexImage *Img)
 Iterate from this value.

int kC_GetMaxX (const TComplexImage *Img)
 Iterate to this value minus one (the image is zero indexed).

int kC_GetMaxY (const TComplexImage *Img)
 Iterate to this value minus one (the image is zero indexed).

bool kC_ApplyBias (FLOAT32 Bias, TComplexImage *pImg)
 adds Bias to all pixels.

bool kC_ScaleIntensity (FLOAT32 Prefactor, TComplexImage *pImg)
 scales the real and imaginary colors using a constant multiplier.

bool kC_Add (TComplexImage *pAddend, TComplexImage *pImg)
 calulates the sum of two TComplexImages.

bool kC_Subtract (TComplexImage *pSubtrahend, TComplexImage *pImg)
 calulates the difference of two TIntImages.

bool kC_Multiply (TComplexImage *pImg, TComplexImage *pFactor)
 calculates product of two images The border (if present) is not affected.

bool kC_CCFactorAndMultiply (TComplexImage *pImg, TComplexImage *pFactor)
 calculates product of two images.

bool kC_ComplexConjugate (TComplexImage *pImg)
 changes sign of the imaginary part The border (if present) is not affected.

bool kC_Rearrange (TComplexImage *pImg)
 swaps diagonal quarters The border (if present) is not affected.

bool kC_CopyDisplace (int dx, int dy, TComplexImage *pImg)
 performs a displacement so that (dx,dy) in the old picture becomes (0,0).

bool kC_CutOrZeroPad (TComplexImage *pSource, TComplexImage *pDest)
 copies an image into another of different size without scaling.

 copies two images of type TImage into a TComplexImage as real and imaginary parts.

 copies two images of type TIntImage into a TComplexImage as real and imaginary parts.

bool kC_CopyFromFloat (TComplexImage *pDest, TFloatImage *pRe, TFloatImage *pIm)
 copies two images of type TFloatImage into a TComplexImage as real and imaginary parts.

void kC_PrintImageInfo (const TComplexImage *pInfo)
 Prints the information contained in "pInfo" to stdout.

bool kC_DrawLine (T2DInt Start, T2DInt End, FLOAT32 Value, TComplexImage *pDest)
 Draws a line in image using the graphics routine k_GraphicsGenerateLine().

Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C ComplexImage routines, last updated 7/15/2002.

Basic image functions for pixels of type float (both a real an imaginar part), to be used as stand alone c functions, also used by the IPL98 C++ library. The functions works on the TComplexImage structure. These functions are part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
0.91
Author:
Ivar Balslev, ivb@mip.sdu.dk

Function Documentation

bool kC_Add (  TComplexImage *    pImg,
TComplexImage *    pAddend
) 
 

calulates the sum of two TComplexImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pImg  is a pointer to the source-destination image of type TComplexImage
pAddend  is a pointer to the image of type TComplexImage to be added
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty or have different size
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

bool kC_AllocImage (  UINT32    Width,
UINT32    Height,
TComplexImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Initialises a new image with given dimensions.

All pixel colors are initialised to 0. Sets Origin to "RAM", origo to (0,0) and size of border to 0.

Returns :
false, if pInfo is a NULL pointer.
See also:

TComplexImage *    pFactor
) 
 

calculates product of two images.

*pFactor is complex conjugated before multiplication The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:

pFactor  a pointer to the image of type TComplexImage to be complex conjugated and multiplied

bool kC_CopyDisplace (  int    dx,
int    dy,
TComplexImage *    pImg
) 
 

performs a displacement so that (dx,dy) in the old picture becomes (0,0).

Periodic continuation is assumed. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
dx  is the horizontal displacement
dy  is the vertical displacement
pImg  is a pointer to the source image
Returns :
False if *pImg is empty
Version:
0.80
Author:

bool kC_CopyFromByte (  TComplexImage *    pDest,
TImage *    pRe,
TImage *    pIm
) 
 

copies two images of type TImage into a TComplexImage as real and imaginary parts.

If the image *pIm is empty or has dimensions different from *pRe, then the imaginary part becomes zero. *pDest attains the same dimensions as the *pRe. History from *pRe and pIm are copied to *pDest, old history in *pDest is deleted.

Parameters:
pDest  a pointer to destination image
pRe  a pointer to the source image to be the real part
pIm  a pointer to the source image to be the imaginary part
Returns :
False if the image *pRe is empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

Definition at line 1358 of file c_kernel_functions.c.

bool kC_CopyFromFloat (  TComplexImage *    pDest,
TFloatImage *    pRe,
TFloatImage *    pIm
) 
 

copies two images of type TFloatImage into a TComplexImage as real and imaginary parts.

If the image *pIm is empty or has dimensions different from *pRe, then the imaginary part becomes zero. *pDest attains the same dimensions as the pRe. History from *pRe and pIm are copied to *pDest, old history in *pDest is deleted.

Parameters:
pRe  a pointer to the source image to be the real part
pIm  a pointer to the source image to be the imaginary part
pDest  a pointer to the destination image
Returns :
False if the image *pRe
Version:

bool kC_CopyImage (  TComplexImage *    pDest,
const TComplexImage *    pSource
) 
 

Copies whole image from "pSource" to "pDest".

All information is copied to the destination image including border pixels, palette and history. Previous data in "pDest" are destroyed, including the old history. Origin is set to RAM. File information is left empty.

Returns :
False, if source image is empty.

bool kC_CopySubImage (  int    xmin,
int    ymin,
int    xmax,
int    ymax,
TComplexImage *    pDest,
const TComplexImage *    pSource
) 
 

Copy rectangel from "pSource" to "pDest".

Starting from (xmin,ymin) (including min values) and ending at (xmax,ymax) (excluding max values). Previous data in "pDest" are destroyed. Origin is set to RAM.

Returns :
false if rectangel is outside dimensions of source image or if source image is empty.

Referenced by kC_FlipHorisontal().

bool kC_CutOrZeroPad (  TComplexImage *    pSource,
TComplexImage *    Dest
) 
 

copies an image into another of different size without scaling.

The origin is retained. For increasing width/height, zero padding is applied. Simple cuts are applied for reduced width/height. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pDest  must be allocated prior to calling
pSource  is a pointer to the source image
Returns :
False if *pSource and/or *pDest are empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

Deletes all allocated memory for image, origo to (0,0), sets colors in pInfo to zero and all pointers to NULL.

Origin is set to "EMPTY"

bool kC_Load (  const char *    FileName,
TComplexImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Load given file into "pInfo".

The file name must include a relative or absolut path and the name of the file with extension, both characters '/' and '\' can be used to seperate folder names (remember to "escape" the character '\', ex. "c:\\test.bmp"). The type of the file is determined by the given extension. Origin is set to "DISC".

bool kC_ScaleIntensity (  FLOAT32    Prefactor,
TComplexImage *    pImg
) 
 

scales the real and imaginary colors using a constant multiplier.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pImg  is a pointer to the source-target image of type TComplexImage
Prefactor  is the scaling factor
Returns :
False if the image is empty

bool kC_SetPeriodicBorder (  unsigned short    BorderSize,
TComplexImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Expands the image periodically in the border of size BorderSize.

If a border of size BorderSize is present in pInfo it is used, otherwise a new border of BorderSize is created.

Parameters:
BorderSize  Size of border to copy image periodically to.
Returns :
false if BorderSize is bigger than either width or height of pInfo.

bool kC_Subtract (  TComplexImage *    pImg,
TComplexImage *    pSubtrahend
) 
 

calulates the difference of two TIntImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:

pSubtrahend  is a pointer to the image of type TIntImage to be subtracted
Returns :
